Data: 2pm West Indies win the toss and bowl. Ricky Ponting called incorrectly, but he's pretty happy to get a chance to bat first. The start has been pushed back by half an hour, but they are still intending to play the full 20 overs.
Taylor to Marsh, no run a slower ball to start, outside off stump, and through to the keeper
Taylor to Marsh, no run good sharp length, jagging into the splice. Defended to the gully
Taylor to Marsh, no run quick and jagging. Lovely bowling, outside off, nipping off the moist deck, and Marsh is well beaten
Taylor to Marsh, 2 runs full length, and swished chancily into the leg-side. Marsh gets enough bat on it to clear the infield, and he's off the mark
Taylor to Marsh, no run more sharp movement, zipping into the left-hander, and Taylor nods approvingly in his followthrough
Taylor to Marsh, 1 wide down the legside, well gathered, but that's an easy call for the umpire
Taylor to Marsh, SIX runs in the slot, and thumped majestically down the ground for a maximum. Cracking stroke. He looked all at sea for much of that over, but he's still taken it for nine runs
Benn to Ronchi, no run good length to start, on off stump and pushed into the covers
Benn to Ronchi, no run lovely bite and bounce, Benn uses his height well, and Ramdin half appeals for a stumping
Benn to Ronchi, no run tweaking past off stump again, excellent bounce and Ramdin leaps as he takes
Benn to Ronchi, 1 run clipped into the leg side, and Ronchi's off the mark
Benn to Marsh, 1 run walloped into the covers, and that was technically a chance. But it was actually three runs saved. Bravo got his fingertips to it, goalkeeper style, brave effort
Benn to Ronchi, 1 run good end to a tight and tidy over
Taylor to Ronchi, SIX runs incredible shot! He backed away, hung his bat out as if he was a scared tailender, and yet timed it so sweetly that it flew all the way over backward point! Remarkable
Taylor to Ronchi, FOUR runs inside-out clobber over the covers. Dramatic striking, and the runs are flowing
Taylor to Ronchi, FOUR runs opens the shoulders, and strikes through the line like a golfer. Didn't come off the middle of the bat, but a one-bounce four will do nicely
Taylor to Ronchi, no run slower ball, yorker length, big appeal, but just drifting down. Good riposte
Taylor to Ronchi, no run short and climbing off the pitch, Ronchi attempted to steer that over third man, but didn't make contact. For once
Taylor to Ronchi, no run another slower ball, and that's an excellent comeback. Ronchi swings into a slog sweep, but the ball is through to the keeper
Benn to Marsh, 1 run full toss, and that's a bit of a let-off. Marsh can't time his slog, and midwicket fields
Benn to Ronchi, 1 wide down the leg side
Benn to Ronchi, FOUR runs smacked in the air, over mid-off, who can't quite reach as he leaps. It looks as though Bravo is unaware that the Powerplays are over
Benn to Ronchi, FOUR runs cut, and cut hard, whistles through point
Benn to Ronchi, 1 run driven hard and straight, Benn gets a finger on the ball, but still a single
Benn to Marsh, 1 run shovelled into the covers
Benn to Ronchi, FOUR runs down on one knee, and slapped violently through midwicket. West Indies' field placings are all at sea, and Australia are taking ruthless advantage
Edwards to Marsh, no run full toss, outside off stump. Not a bad delivery in the circumstances
Edwards to Marsh, 2 runs swished out to deep midwicket, and a cheeky second run as Pollard's throw goes wide
Edwards to Marsh, 1 run driven firm and straight, Perkins the debutant fields at long-on
Edwards to Ronchi, no run full length and inswinging, a massive mow from Ronchi, but no connection
Edwards to Ronchi, 1 leg bye Ronchi backed away, so Edwards followed him, good bowling
Edwards to Marsh, 1 run fast and straight, defended into the covers for a single. Good over
Roach to Marsh, (no ball) 1 run beamer! And a nasty one too. Marsh swings in self-defence, and the ball flies down to third man off his gloves
Roach to Ronchi, 1 run dropped - superb bounce and carry, Ronchi fended it through to the keeper, who muffed the chance. It is getting very dark
Roach to Marsh, 1 run pummelled down the ground
Roach to Ronchi, FOUR runs too much width, and slashed past backward point. Ronchi gave himself room, but reached it well in the end
Roach to Ronchi, 2 runs had to scamper as the throw came in from the covers, but safely home
Roach to Ronchi, no run excellent slower ball, just kept out at the last minute
Roach to Ronchi, OUT in the slot and slapped down the ground, but not enough bat on it, and the home boy has a debut wicket!
Edwards to Marsh, 1 run clipped off the pads
Edwards to Watson, 1 run short and on the pads, Benn at short backward point fields well, but winds himself in the process
Edwards to Marsh, 1 run full toss, clobbered over cover, and picked up in the deep
Edwards to Watson, 1 run attempted yorker, a hint of inswing, and swished out to midwicket
Edwards to Marsh, no run slower-ball bouncer. Quite a cunning plan, that one
Edwards to Marsh, FOUR runs in the slot and mowed across the line. Deep midwicket can't cut that off
Roach to Watson, no run very decent pace, outside off stump, and Watson is beaten
Roach to Watson, 1 leg bye a touch too straight, but Watson misses out with a leg-side flick
Roach to Marsh, no run smashed back down the ground, and Roach instinctively sticks out a mitt, and saves four runs
Roach to Marsh, SIX runs that's vast - clean as a whistle over long-on. TImed to perfection and that carries 98 metres, apparently

Roach to Marsh, OUT what a catch! That was short and swung out to deep midwicket. Marshall, running towards the rope, leaps, takes cleanly, then tiptoes along the boundary rope, just inches inside. He keeps his balance and that's a key breakthrough
Roach to Watson, no run tucked behind square
Bravo to Hussey, no run slower ball from the skipper. Well bowled
Bravo to Hussey, OUT another slower ball, and Hussey is onto that far too quickly. A spiralling top-edge and Perkins at midwicket judges it well
Bravo to Watson, no run flicked straight to square leg, thoughts about a single, but the throw comes in to persuade him otherwise
Bravo to Watson, 1 run angled into the blockhole from around the wicket. Driven down the ground
Bravo to White, 1 run an agonisingly slow slower ball, eventually cut behind square
Bravo to Watson, FOUR runs aiming for the blockhole again, but swung lustily into the gap at deep midwicket, where it neatly bissects two fielders
Roach to White, 1 run floated onto a good length, White opens his shoulders for the drive, but can't time it as the ball plugs in front of long-off
Roach to Watson, 1 run low full toss, shovelled out to midwicket
Roach to White, FOUR runs not a bad ball at all, slow and full, but White gets under it and times it to perfection, inside-out, over cover
Roach to White, 1 run flogged with even more power into the covers, but picked up by the sweeper
Roach to Watson, no run bouncer, and a good one too. Close to a wide, but well directed
Roach to Watson, SIX runs not such a good bouncer. Short again, and Watson was waiting this time. Sweet connection, into the Hall and Griffiths stand at midwicket
Bravo to White, 2 runs low full toss, clipped out to midwicket, a tight call for the second run, but they make it comfortably in the end
Bravo to White, 1 run outside leg stump, flicked down to fine leg
Bravo to Watson, no run a pre-meditated paddle-sweep, so Bravo bounces it over his shoulder. Good bowling
Bravo to Watson, no run a swing and a miss. Quite possibly the first of the innings
Bravo to Watson, 2 runs slower ball again, swatted back down the ground, and long-on fields
Bravo to Watson, 1 run Watson wound himself up for the big strike, but succeeds only in whisking the ball round the corner for one more run
Well, that was relentless stuff. West Indies need 98, and I need an ice-bath for my fingertips. Back in five
Here's Mitchell Johnson
Lee to Marshall, SIX runs that's the way to launch a run-chase! Short and aimed at the body, so Marshall swivels into a pull, and deposits Lee in the stands!
Lee to Marshall, no run a swish and a miss this time. Too much dancing at the crease
Lee to Marshall, 1 run fast and straight, but Perkins responds well to the call
Lee to Perkins, no run outside off, and swinging away. Welcome to international cricket. Perkins hangs out a limp bat, but at least he survived
Lee to Perkins, 1 run advancing down the track, and pulled - not entirely convincingly - into space at midwicket. Perkins is off the mark
Lee to Marshall, 1 run angled into the pads, and clipped away to fine leg
Johnson to Marshall, 4 byes bonus runs! Short, and climbs steeply off the deck, over the sprawling keeper and away to the boundary
Johnson to Marshall, SIX runs a vast strike! Clobbered high and handsome over deep midwicket. That was an open-shouldered drive, and so sweetly timed
Johnson to Marshall, 3 wide chaotic cricket. A wide, a fumble, a cheeky run, a desperate dive, and more runs for the cause
Johnson to Marshall, 1 run full length, and an inside-edged drive into the covers
Johnson to Perkins, 1 leg bye a squawked appeal, but that pitched outside leg. Another run

Johnson to Marshall, SIX runs massive! Massive! That was fetched off a good length with the most monstrous of wind-ups, and that hits the roof of the Greenidge and Haynes stand. West Indies are brawling, as a replacement ball comes out
Johnson to Marshall, FOUR runs galloping down the track, and a chancy under-edge, but that'll do for West Indies! No fielder at fine leg, and another boundary to the cause
Lee to Perkins, FOUR runs ballsy cricket! Perkins goes down on one knee, to Lee of all bowlers, and defies all dental appointments by flicking the ball over his shoulder for four!
Lee to Perkins, 2 wide another cracking stolen single. West Indies are on the ball
Lee to Marshall, 1 run down the track to a length delivery, an instant call as midwicket swoops, but he fumbles and they are home
Lee to Perkins, 1 run down the track again, Lee responds with a low full-toss, but it's shovelled into the covers
Lee to Marshall, FOUR runs cracked away through the off side, stunning open-shouldered strokeplay!
Lee to Marshall, FOUR runs gave himself room, and walloped it as hard and straight as you can imagine, all along the ground!
Lee to Marshall, 1 run neatly tucked off the hip, and that's 17 runs off the over!
Watson to Marshall, 1 run length delivery, smacked with a golf swing to deep midwicket
Watson to Perkins, 1 run back of a length and dabbed to gully. An instant run, and again the throw goes wide. Australia are under pressure
Watson to Ramdin, 1 run whipped off the hip, a bit of a top edge, but it lands safe at square leg
Watson to Perkins, 1 run slower ball, Perkins waits well, and clips to midwicket
Watson to Ramdin, 1 run slow and short, not quite a bouncer length, but Ramdin waits and thumps it down to third man
Hopes to Ramdin, 1 run outside off and driven hard into the covers
Hopes to Perkins, no run short, and a swing and a miss. Ramdin comes down to have a quiet word. There's no need for that
Hopes to Perkins, no run another dot ball, and a good one too. Good length, and a hint of nip off the pitch
Hopes to Perkins, 1 run thumped down the ground without much timing, but another run
Hopes to Ramdin, 1 run nice shot, back of a length, and dabbed down to third man
Watson to Bravo, 1 run on the back foot and dabbed down to the gully
Watson to Ramdin, FOUR runs a deft steer, clean through the vacant first slip! That's the boundary they've needed. It was another slower ball, and he waited well
Watson to Bravo, 1 run slower ball again, and steered backward of square with a slow-motion pull
Watson to Fletcher, no run cracking delivery, in the channel outside off, and angling in as well. Fletcher is beaten
Watson to Fletcher, no run another slower ball, dabbed to point, to complete a fine over
White to Bravo, no run outside off, and left well alone
White to Bravo, 1 wide quicker ball, but misdirected
White to Bravo, 1 wide another one slides down leg. Not what the skipper ordered
White to Bravo, no run drilled out to point
White to Bravo, 2 byes a beautiful delivery, at last, but it deceives everyone, not least the keeper. Extras are keeping West Indies in the hunt in this over
White to Bravo, SIX runs short, and slapped handsomely over backward square. A rank long-hop, to be honest
White to Bravo, no run better ball. Defended into the covers
White to Bravo, no run a fuller length, and it almost sneaks through. Either way, it's a dot ball
Johnson to Fletcher, no run a swing and a miss. Good ball, angling across the right hander
Johnson to Fletcher, 1 run off the mark with a leg-side single
Johnson to Bravo, SIX runs remarkable shot! That was a violent outside edge, one hand came off the bat as well, but the ball cleared Brett Lee at third man by a distance
Johnson to Bravo, 1 run guided to third man for an intelligent single. West Indies are ahead of the rate this over
Johnson to Fletcher, 1 run full length but outside off, guided to third man for another single
Johnson to Bravo, 1 run short, banged in towards the gloves, an attempted single is turned down, but they claim one for the rebound as the shy hits the stumps from the gully
Hopes to Bravo, 1 run jabbed down to third man, singles all over the place now
Hopes to Fletcher, 1 leg bye hit in the groin, but an instant call for the single. Hopes fields well in his followthrough, but Bravo is safely home
Hopes to Bravo, FOUR runs up and over the covers handsomely! That was in the slot for the shot, and he went for it well!
Hopes to Bravo, 1 run pulled out to midwicket. West Indies are all but home and hosed
Hopes to Fletcher, FOUR runs stand and deliver! That was pitched up towards the blockhole, but Fletcher drove through the line, inside-out, and two bounces into the extra cover advertising hoardings!
Hopes to Fletcher, no run an anticlimactic dot to finish the over ...
Watson to Bravo, SIX runs outside off, and smacked handsomely, gloriously, over deep midwicket for a maximum! What a way to win it!
Thanks for your patience, it was worth it in the end. I've been Andrew Miller, goodnight.

A brilliant momentum-seizing 36 from 15 balls from Xavier Marshall set the tone of this run-chase. Once he was gone, it was just a run a ball that West Indies needed. Routine stuff in this day and age.

A sensational run-chase from West Indies. It is getting as dark as the World Cup final now, but Bravo saw that like a beachball. That's the first Twenty20 international in the Caribbean, and what a marker it's laid down. England might not fancy their chances of those Stanford millions after all ...
West Indies won by 7 wickets (with 11 balls remaining)
Player of the match is Xavier Marshall, WI
